title: Geordie
summary: Geordie (/ˈdʒɔːrdi/) is a nickname for a person from the Tyneside area of North East England,[1] and the dialect used by its inhabitants, also known in linguistics as Tyneside English or Newcastle English. There are different definitions of what constitutes a Geordie. The term is used and has been historically used to refer to the people of the North East.[2][3][4][5][6] A Geordie can also specifically be a native of Tyneside (especially Newcastle upon Tyne) and the surrounding areas.[5][6][7] Not everyone from the North East of England identifies as a Geordie.[8][9]
